alert.note: Alert for Macomb; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 2:20AM EDT until July 13 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following counties, Macomb and St. Clair. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 216 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing of poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Huron, Richmond, Romeo, Yale, Capac, Lakeport, Marysville, Armada, Memphis, Emmett, New Haven, Brockway, Washington, Blaine, Columbus, Riley Center, Goodells, Berville, Avoca and Smiths Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
